auto_merge.commit_message:
Problem:
`vim.diff()` was introduced before we had the `vim.text` module, where
it obviously belongs.

Solution:
Move it.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
`vim.diff()` was introduced before we had the `vim.text` module, where it obviously belongs.

Solution:
Move it.

comment_data.body:
I'd prefer we leave out the `vim.deprecate()` call here and follow line 1392 with just a comment:

```lua
--- Renamed to `vim.text.diff`, remove at Nvim 1.0
--- @deprecated
vim.diff = vim.text.diff
```

Then all the type information is propagated.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1389,10 +1389,17 @@ end
 
 require('vim._options')
 
--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
+--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
 ---@deprecated
 vim.loop = vim.uv
 
+--- Renamed to `vim.text.diff`
+---@deprecated
+function vim.diff(...)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.diff()', 'vim.text.diff()', '1.0')

comment_data.body:
Tried that, but:

```
vim/_init_packages.lua:71: module 'vim.text' not found:
	no field package.preload['vim.text']
	no file './vim/text.lua'
...
```

Will need to live without the type info on `vim.diff` (unless/until luals supports things like `typeof vim.text.diff`)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1389,10 +1389,17 @@ end
 
 require('vim._options')
 
--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
+--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
 ---@deprecated
 vim.loop = vim.uv
 
+--- Renamed to `vim.text.diff`
+---@deprecated
+function vim.diff(...)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.diff()', 'vim.text.diff()', '1.0')

comment_data.body: Not using explicit `a, b, opts` parameters because `xdiff_spec.lua` checks for specific errors that don't get triggered if I don't use `...` here. If anyone wants to debate this, try it locally, can always revisit later. Not a blocker for this PR.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2,6 +2,80 @@
 
 local M = {}
 
+--- Optional parameters:
+--- @class vim.text.diff.Opts
+--- @inlinedoc
+---
+--- Invoked for each hunk in the diff. Return a negative number
+--- to cancel the callback for any remaining hunks.
+--- Arguments:
+---   - `start_a` (`integer`): Start line of hunk in {a}.
+---   - `count_a` (`integer`): Hunk size in {a}.
+---   - `start_b` (`integer`): Start line of hunk in {b}.
+---   - `count_b` (`integer`): Hunk size in {b}.
+--- @field on_hunk? fun(start_a: integer, count_a: integer, start_b: integer, count_b: integer): integer?
+---
+--- Form of the returned diff:
+---   - `unified`: String in unified format.
+---   - `indices`: Array of hunk locations.
+--- Note: This option is ignored if `on_hunk` is used.
+--- (default: `'unified'`)
+--- @field result_type? 'unified'|'indices'
+---
+--- Run linematch on the resulting hunks from xdiff. When integer, only hunks
+--- upto this size in lines are run through linematch.
+--- Requires `result_type = indices`, ignored otherwise.
+--- @field linematch? boolean|integer
+---
+--- Diff algorithm to use. Values:
+---   - `myers`: the default algorithm
+---   - `minimal`: spend extra time to generate the smallest possible diff
+---   - `patience`: patience diff algorithm
+---   - `histogram`: histogram diff algorithm
+--- (default: `'myers'`)
+--- @field algorithm? 'myers'|'minimal'|'patience'|'histogram'
+--- @field ctxlen? integer Context length
+--- @field interhunkctxlen? integer Inter hunk context length
+--- @field ignore_whitespace? boolean Ignore whitespace
+--- @field ignore_whitespace_change? boolean Ignore whitespace change
+--- @field ignore_whitespace_change_at_eol? boolean Ignore whitespace change at end-of-line.
+--- @field ignore_cr_at_eol? boolean Ignore carriage return at end-of-line
+--- @field ignore_blank_lines? boolean Ignore blank lines
+--- @field indent_heuristic? boolean Use the indent heuristic for the internal diff library.
+
+-- luacheck: no unused args
+
+--- Run diff on strings {a} and {b}. Any indices returned by this function,
+--- either directly or via callback arguments, are 1-based.
+---
+--- Examples:
+---
+--- ```lua
+--- vim.text.diff('a\n', 'b\nc\n')
+--- -- =>
+--- -- @@ -1 +1,2 @@
+--- -- -a
+--- -- +b
+--- -- +c
+---
+--- vim.text.diff('a\n', 'b\nc\n', {result_type = 'indices'})
+--- -- =>
+--- -- {
+--- --   {1, 1, 1, 2}
+--- -- }
+--- ```
+---
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: undefined-doc-param
+---@param a string First string to compare
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: undefined-doc-param
+---@param b string Second string to compare
+---@diagnostic disable-next-line: undefined-doc-param
+---@param opts? vim.text.diff.Opts
+---@return string|integer[][]? # See {opts.result_type}. `nil` if {opts.on_hunk} is given.
+function M.diff(...)
+  return vim._diff(...)

comment_data.body:
Does adding `vim._diff = vim.text.diff` to the metafile work?

Otherwise it's probably best to define `vim._diff` properly in the metafile, and work everything around that.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1389,10 +1389,17 @@ end
 
 require('vim._options')
 
--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
+--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
 ---@deprecated
 vim.loop = vim.uv
 
+--- Renamed to `vim.text.diff`
+---@deprecated
+function vim.diff(...)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.diff()', 'vim.text.diff()', '1.0')

comment_data.body: Type info is provided in latest push. Anyone that needs the docs can visit `vim.text.diff`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1389,10 +1389,17 @@ end
 
 require('vim._options')
 
--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
+--- Remove at Nvim 1.0
 ---@deprecated
 vim.loop = vim.uv
 
+--- Renamed to `vim.text.diff`
+---@deprecated
+function vim.diff(...)
+  vim.deprecate('vim.diff()', 'vim.text.diff()', '1.0')

comment_regular_data.body:
PUC lua failure:

```
FAILED   test/functional/lua/xdiff_spec.lua @ 94: xdiff bindings can diff text with error callback
test/functional/lua/xdiff_spec.lua:95: Expected objects to be the same.
Passed in:
(string) 'error running function on_hunk: .../xdiff_spec.lua:0: ERROR1'
Expected:
(string) '.../xdiff_spec.lua:0: error running function on_hunk: .../xdiff_spec.lua:0: ERROR1'

stack traceback:
	(tail call): ?
	test/functional/lua/xdiff_spec.lua:95: in function <test/functional/lua/xdiff_spec.lua:94>

FAILED   test/functional/lua/xdiff_spec.lua @ 171: xdiff bindings can handle bad args
test/functional/lua/xdiff_spec.lua:174: Expected objects to be the same.
Passed in:
(string) 'bad argument #1 to '_diff' (expected string)'
Expected:
(string) 'bad argument #1 to 'diff' (expected string)'
```
oops, i forgot this was set to auto-merge. need to fix the zig build. #34909

somehow this broke `vim.diff`, gitsigns runs it [in a thread](https://github.com/lewis6991/gitsigns.nvim/blob/4666d040b60d1dc0e474ccd9a3fd3c4d67b4767c/lua/gitsigns/diff_int.lua#L49-L54).

Reverted that change for now: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34909/commits/fbf156dd64a32af721cf4d511e5c71127873fe14

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(lua): rename vim.diff => vim.text.diff
